storyInfo: After the mirage fades, the four find a bloodied Arts Circle. Hoederer learns the Liches are preparing a piecemeal evacuation plan for Kazdel, then proposes to Ermengarde that he'll seize the 'Lifeline', and use this transport method capable of vast ranges to help bring the Sarkaz back home.

attributes.text: I've never felt my blood flowing so clearly through my own veins.
\nIt surges about like crazy, shooting out through my limbs, then finally converging on my heart again.
At Rhodes Island, when the Medic operators were examining me, they wanted to inject me with... what was it called? I forget.
I sure gave them hell about that. I've got the Originiumâ€”I didn't want more random junk around in my body.
\nWell, fine. I get the message. We need all this blood to live.
It carries oxygen and yadda-yadda, whatever, Hoederer told me once.
\nBut right now, I'm sick of it.
You're my blood, you little shit, so listen to me.
\nAnd if not, you can get the hell out of my body.
I feel for the dagger on my waist.

attributes.content: *sighhhh*â€”
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: W, what the hell is wrong with you?!
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Nothing. Just some bloodletting.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.text: Hoederer scrunches his brow. That Lich is giving her hat a death grip.
\nThe racket finally dies down. No, actually, I guess we hardy bunch just got used to it.

attributes.content: Ines, are you alright?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Absolutely nothing's wrong with me. YOU guys explain.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I get it! These rocks don't work on chilly old hags. I bet Kal'tsit could dance a whole jig here.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I'd believe it. I'd also suggest you bandage that wound.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I cut surgical. Avoided the arteries.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: So, this is an anti-Sarkaz installation? Something to do with the blood?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Sarkaz. Blood. Heh, there's a difficult guess.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: This witchcraft device... hasn't properly activated yet.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Hm... I drew past this area on the uneasy feeling I had. Here lies the main offender.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Little wonder the tutors are always so cautious with matters of Londinium.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: So what if it does activate for real? All Sarkaz explode and die? And then the Sanguinarch throws our blood all over the Victorians?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: No vehicle tracks in the vicinity... No signs it was transported.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: They took these giant crystals, crossed all these miles, and then set them down here directly?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Somehow... this wouldn't be the first time I've heard of something like that.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Lady Ermengarde... I'm guessing you have nothing to do with this either.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Naturally. Liches can't accomplish this sort of thing. The 'space' we research isn't this one.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Also, if I'm not mistaken, you recognized me just now?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hoederer, was it...? I've had an eye on your books before. Some of your manuscripts are even in circulation among Leithanien's Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Do you have any leads for us?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Why should I be helping you? You just blew up my little cube.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.text: Hrmph. The bitch just shot me a glance.

attributes.content: Hey, you don't know how much I'm holding back from stuffing a bomb in that chest cavity of yours.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Mm-hm. Are all Sarkaz mercenaries so eager to die these days?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.text: If she says one more word, I'm seriously gonna do it.

attributes.content: Forget it.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Let's talk about that illusion just now.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: That was a vestige... a spatial one, a temporal one.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Were you looking for vehicle tracks just now? That illusion was it. Some kind of special Arts is affecting this place.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: But that wasn't Originium Arts, and it wasn't Sarkaz witchcraft.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: These Arts Circles are related to the Vampires, and the illusion was definitely related to the Arts Circles, but there's no direct line connecting them.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Perhaps... these are leads you can use?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: What position are the Liches taking?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The same as ever: we've made no promises.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: But we have an informant telling us, Kazdel has... had Liches showing up too. You usually never make appearances in Kazdel.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You left Babel, joined an Infected organization, then ended up in Londinium, and you've still kept an intelligence net up in Kazdel?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Are you really just a mercenary? I feel like with your competences, you could get hooked up as a GesatzswÃ¤chter in Leithanien, relatively speaking. Oh, except your Arts is a little mediocre.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Personal habits.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Mm-hm... 'Personal habits.'
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: In a battlefield this extensive, how do you think you'd stop me if I did want to leave without a whisper?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: You were... looking for us too?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Technically. I'm a little interested in you. Specifically you.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Do you Sarkaz always have to talk in riddles?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.text: Score one interruption from Ines. She's getting impatient, nice.
Let her draw everyone's attention while I kill this son-of-a-Lich dead.

attributes.content: Given you get news from Kazdel, that naturally means our siblings act's just been feigning ignorance.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: We need, mm, to give Theresis some... flex room. We're taking control of Kazdel right now. Everyone's come to Victoria, so someone's got to look after the place.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: What flex room? Are you gonna hold a celebratory feast?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Yes, that's the first part of the plan. Then we declare national foundation day, and so on.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Haha, no more jokes nowâ€”
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: â€”That is just the first part of the plan.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Theresis and Theresa have no plans for evacuation at all. It seems they really do want Londinium to be the battlefield for a face-off against all the lands.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: We have no idea what's giving them so much confidence, but if it's their plan, brother and sister, then they must have some means in place already.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: So, if they do succeedâ€”then that means we'll have to rebuild Kazdel, rebuild the Sarkaz's haven.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: ...And if they fail?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: If the Sarkaz fail here, then we'll lose an entire generation of youth, and maybe every youth that was to come.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: After the expedition of two hundred years ago, most nations had no clue about the present state of Kazdel. They weren't even interested.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Until all this, a lot of Victorian worthies believed Kazdel was just a pile of ruins.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But before the civil war, with Her Highness Theresa's establishment, Kazdel had a nascent nomadic city.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Until Theresis messed the whole thing up. Now Kazdel's just this supergiant witchcraft tractor, the kind that's got bolts and parts popping off it while it trundles along.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Kazdel wouldn't stand up to anything you could call a war, but the Regent just so happens to be starting one.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Once it begins, every spy will have made contact with Kazdel. How will those nations sitting on the fence... regard the Sarkaz within the territory?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Alright, you're a pessimist. Good, so am I.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: So, part two of the planâ€”the Liches hanging back in Kazdel have formulated the plans to break the place up.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: If Theresis fails, Kazdel will immediately be split into pieces, maybe a dozen or more...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Taking their affiliated residents, as per the apportioned, er, 'clan' units, off to hide deep in the barrens.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Route-planning, balanced production, and ensuring Kazdel becomes a nomadic city isn't without meaning. To the Sarkaz, the enmity of the rest of mankind is a Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Kazdel will greet another age of exile.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.text: Again with the exile.
\nWhat kind of crap is this? As if we're not exiles already? Did I miss some nomadic city where we all live happy lives sipping afternoon tea, watching the Catastrophe clouds roll by?

attributes.content: The Sarkaz are strongly united at this point. Not at all the way I hoped... but purely in terms of endpoint, Theresis has done it.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But unity could mean more than just another vengeful massacre.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Despite that unity being founded on hatred and war? That's no easy ask, Hoederer, my brother.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Kazdel is more than a city. It's every person who calls it home.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: In the original plan, Kazdel didn't need that many inhabitants... and they wouldn't let us take that many away, anyway.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: We have to end this war in Victoria. The sooner, the better.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: If we can't take back hate, then the least we can do is turn it to fuel, to cast the supports of Kazdel.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: And every life, to the Kazdel of the future, may well be vital.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Easily said for youâ€”
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: We just touched on a method for moving supplies and people over long distances. That might be what we've been after this whole timeâ€”what serves as the Military Commission's 'lifeline' in Londinium.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I'll find it, and seize it. It was able to bring us to Londinium, so... it can take us home too.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Before everyone's buried six feet under.
attributes.name: Hoederer
Ermengarde
attributes.content: You aren't certain to succeed. You're just a mercenary.
'A place to call home: somewhere you can always return to.'
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.text: Theresa.
\nAll this time, I've been trying to keep that name separate from this war.
Her Highness...
\nHow can a war just like before let anyone rest in peace?
Haha, I bet it's just some diversion by that Theresis bastard. He killed Her Highness, and he's still blaspheming her.
\nI'll make him beg forgiveness on his hands and knees.
\nAnd once he's done, then I'll turn his skull into fireworks.

attributes.content: Finding you was the right choice. I'll take your plans as the stance of... Babel's survivors, and inform the Liches.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But you blew up my cube! How do you want me to get back, on foot?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Eight kilometers northwest, there's a Sarkaz transport camp. Go and steal their car.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Need us to help?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Forget it.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: I don't want her catching me again and finding out I've been making deals with you on the sly.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: So, good luck to you, and may you... still be alive to make good on your promise after meeting her.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.text: 'Her'?
\nHold on.

attributes.content: Are you guys getting this... familiar feeling?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: What are you talking about?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.text: What AM I talking about? I have no idea.
\nDammit, Hoederer should be the one saying moody crap like this.
But still, what's bugging me?
Not far off, there's someone sitting on a mountain peak. Just on the edge of where that original illusion vanished.
\nShe's just sitting there, like she doesn't have a care in her heart.
\nHer long pink hair draped over her shoulders, as it always was.
And that look in her eyes, that... sorrowful...
I look away.
How is this happening?
\nHow, how, how...?
No, that's no illusion...
\nThe moment I saw her, I knew it wasn't.
That's her.

attributes.content: ...Your Highness?
attributes.name: W

attributes.text: She's gone.
\nI want to reach out toâ€”
No, forget it.
\nMaybe I should save it for next time.
\nBesides... she couldn't have been real anyway.
She just... really, really looked like her. An indistinguishable forgery. Able to fool almost any pair of screwy, messed-up eyeballs.
